intro: Telophyllum quadriflorum, commonly known as the four-flowered telophyllum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Telophyllum quadriflorum is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique and diverse plant community in the region.
